content: i'm working on the feature illustrations for zulipchat.com, but have troubles figuring out how to represent open-source. suggestions would be appreciated! it doesn't have to necessarily incorporate the underwater theme. the one attempt i had made was an octocat reference, but i don't think it works. opensource.png
@Vaida Plankyte Do ping @Nitin Jain I think he is also working on the same right now.

How about some translucent marine animals? (as in the source code is visible to all)
http://pulptastic.com/22-species-see-wildlife-really-letting-hang/

Regarding the octocat. I got this from the GitHub logos page (https://github.com/logos)

Please don’t do these things
* Use the Octocat or GitHub logo for your application’s icon
* Create a modified version of the Octocat or GitHub logo
I don't think this can be considered as a modified version of the Octocat, it's just a distant reference.
For instance, they're okay with the Octodex.
Alright then :)
But yeah, we should definitely keep an eye to avoid infringing any copyright :)

thanks for the feedback y'all :)
@Saket Kumar pinged him!
ah, good to know this would still be okay in terms of Octocat!
i did a quick "pandora's box" that would symbolise the source code being available: pandora.png
@Vishnu Ks i like the idea of translucent animals a lot, though i do feel it might be hard to communicate-- what can you see through the animals? :D
I like the pandora's box idea; how about that with more "movement"? E.g. the fish etc shooting out to spread themselves around the world?
Also @Saket Kumar @Nitin Jain make sure to coordinate with me and Vaida if you're going to be working on illustrations, so that we're working on the highest priority stuff, and not duplicating work.
Yes, agree with you @Rishi Gupta I had talked with vaida and for now, I skipped that illustration part. Now my main concern is platform page. I'm doing ui part of that page.

@Rishi Gupta having troubles communicating movement. here are a couple iterations. which one should i expand on?

pandora.png pandora2.png
The second one communicates more movement to me, but maybe if some fish were overlapped in the first version it could feel more movement-ish.
I think you need to show somebody opening the box, perhaps somebody with 8 limbs. (The metaphor is literal, since Zulip was once closed source.) I actually prefer a door to a box.
ooh, i like the idea of a door!

Doors don't entirely make sense underwater, haha, but I'll riff on this idea to see if it gives you any inspirations. I imagine two doors, actually. On the left is a closed door with a menacing shark with their fins crossed guarding the door. On the right is our friendly octopus opening the door to reveal happy fishes and underwater treasures.

the 'door not supposed to be there' just makes me think of Scott Pilgrim haha. I was thinking of starting small and just having a door that is full of fish activity and has fish coming out of it (similarly to the second illustration). will iterate on this in the next day!
And then the right-hand door is hinged on the left, so as the octopus opens it, the door slightly obscures the shark.
i do like the idea, but it might be quite hard to fit into an illustration that will be 150-200 pixels
I don't draw often, but I do watch a lot of 2D animation and one way people emphasize motion is through motion lines, demonstrated in this airplane illustration. Maybe use this link as a reference?
cheers @Cynthia Lin ! love the creative bloq :D
How about making all the fish leaving the box only go up? I also like the idea of motion lines.
@Steve Howell @Cynthia Lin @Rishi Gupta ping! opendoor.png

pandora3.png
and here is the updated pandora box!

Huge improvement! I really like the door one. Maybe you can put some precious metals/stones and treasure in the box to show that something valuable is in the box? I see that there's some colored space in there and I think it can be put to better use by doing this
@Cynthia Lin pandora3.png something along these lines? :)
Yep, looks great! Although I noticed the box is a bit misshapen (???), just a minor detail that might be worth fixing
it's supposed to be slightly off, but i agree that it's a bit much in the current illustration-- made changes. :)
